qas.question: Is the trade of pesticides and pesticide treated goods limited to the United States?
What commitee deals with differences in rules governing the use of pesticides among different countries?

answers.text: United Nations Food and Agriculture Organization

qas.question: When was the international code which governs the distribution and use of pesticides established?
How recently were voluntary standards of pesticide regulation updated?
When was the UN Food and Agriculture Organization founded?

plausible_answers.text: to create voluntary standards of pesticide regulation for different countries

qas.question: Why was the UN food and Agriculture Organization created in 1985?
When were pesticides first able to be traded across international borders?
In what areas do agriculture methods differ?

context: Though pesticide regulations differ <b7_0>from country to country<b7_0/>, pesticides, and products on which they were used are <a0_0>traded <b8_0>across international borders<b8_0/><a0_0/>. To deal with inconsistencies in regulations among countries, delegates to a conference of the <a1_0>United Nations Food and Agriculture Organization<a1_0/> adopted an International Code of Conduct on the Distribution and Use of Pesticides in <a2_0><b4_0>1985<b4_0/><a2_0/> <b5_0>to create voluntary standards of pesticide regulation for different countries<b5_0/>. The Code was updated in <b6_0>1998<b6_0/> and <a3_0>2002<a3_0/>. The FAO claims that the code has raised awareness about pesticide hazards and decreased the number of countries without restrictions on pesticide use.
